page.title: 06SAINT MARY'S CHURCH.
page.content: The oldest building in Lesbury is {St. Marys church.}It was built some time in the twelfth century.The church is surrounded by graves and trees, these trees are mainly sycamore, horse chestnut and yew trees, but there are also some older ash trees. The graves are{centuries old,}most of them are of the 18 hundreds,some were dug even earlier.There were some old family tombs which had been there so long that they were crumbling or even falling down.The writing engraved on these was also worn away.There were some tiny gravestones for{babies}who had{died}only a few months old.There is a sealed door at the side of the church,known as the{Devil's Door.}It is so named because in a christening it was opened to let the devil out.
